noun.description: An area or stretch of land having a particular characteristic, purpose, or use, or subject to particular restrictions.
examples: the government has declared the city a disaster zone

noun.description: An encircling band or stripe of distinctive color, texture, or character.
A belt or girdle worn around a person's body.

verb.description: Divide into or assign to zones.
examples: the park has been zoned into four distinct bioregions, each with its own ecological identity

verb.description: Encircle as or with a band or stripe.

phrases: I just zoned out for a moment
Do they zone out in church and only catch half the sermon or what?
I was zoning out a little from the heat but Jill Sobule's set brought me right back to earth.
You've been zoning out all day long, what's the problem?
Just zoning out in a bath from 20 minutes to an hour can be a wonderful home-spa experience all by itself, relaxing and private.
origin: Late Middle English: from French, or from Latin zona girdle, from Greek zōnē.
